name: places/ChIJWadH_UrzwokRnzLYTbORhZY
adrFormatAddress: 213 W 230th St, Bronx, NY 10463, USA

originalText.text:
The worst Pizza Hut pizza I‚Äôve ever had.

First off I was a bit disgusted right before leaving the restaurant I saw one of the cooks prepping the pizzas without gloves. He was adding cheese and other toppings without gloves. I mentioned it to the cashier (who I believe is also the manager) and she told me that ‚Äúthey‚Äôre not required to wear gloves.‚Äù  I‚Äôve never heard of such a thing and can‚Äôt imagine a health inspector would approve of that.

Secondly, our pizza was cold, dry and very little cheese. We ordered carry out and waited outside in the car for the 15min we were told it would be ready. The pizza felt lukewarm to the touch but once I got home (we live 5min away) my husband and daughter said the pizza was cold. I then noticed that there was barely any cheese.  The pizza looked like it was a day old. And for first time ever, I watched my daughter put her freshly bought slices in the microwave. We go to Papa John‚Äôs all the time and have to wait nearly 45min for our pizza to be ready. When we get it home it‚Äôs normally still hot and oozing with cheese. This experience at Pizza Hut was so disappointing.

We will never go back to this location. Which is too bad because my daughter was really excited when it opened so close to our house.

The Pizza Hut pizza at Target is 100 times better than this. Unfortunately, you‚Äôre limited to personal pan pizzas at Target but I would much rather buy several personal pan pizzas than to go back at this location in the Bronx. Horrible!!

originalText.text: Stay away - scroll through the reviews and you‚Äôll see management doesn‚Äôt even bother to respond to their feedback which tells you everything you need to know. I requested a refund after coming in to pick up my order (had already been charged online) and seeing these hard inedible rolls presented as ‚Äúfood.‚Äù The cashier FaceTimed some woman who I guess is a manager and had her yell at me through the phone that they ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do refunds.‚Äù I reached out to corporate and after over a month I‚Äôve gotten nowhere. I was robbed, literally, paying for food my fam couldn‚Äôt eat. SAVE YOUR MONEY. RUN. RUN. RUN.

originalText.text: The atmosphere looks very dirty like they don‚Äôt clean , when I went to pick up my order, there was only one person working. She was making pizzas, doing online orders , and taking care of people in the front and not one time she wash her hands even after handling money. She said she was the general manager, and I couldn‚Äôt understand why she would be running a store by herself until 2 AM and such a neighborhood. The food was just gross. The cheese was so chewy. I got stuffed crust pizza and I don‚Äôt know if it was in the oven for a long time but the cheese in the crust pretty much dried out and my toppings were burnt on the top. Overall experience, I would just get dominoes next time.

originalText.text:
My initial experience with this place wasn‚Äôt so great, as I think my pizza had little to no sauce on it and came cold.

I‚Äôve tried it a few times since then over the last year and I‚Äôve had no problems with my orders.

I‚Äôm just outside of Riverdale in Yonkers and whenever I DoorDash from here, my pizza always comes well-cooked and warm. No complaints!

originalText.text: Initially my first experience with this location wasn't the best. However the manager Sapphire contacted me personally which I thought was sooooo professional and caring being in retail management for 10 years now myself. She apologized for not so great experience and explained why it happened which I completely understood. I was given a credit for my next order even more than my original order. I picked up my order today and the staff was very nice and attentive. Store was cool and clean and had nice conversation with the current staff team. Front register guy was really cute too and went a step further to open the door for me to exit. Thanks guys. Food was hot and ready and delicious üòã.
